results.title: Preparing for disaster
results.creator_credit: KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.) and Katie Jennings
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Fire on the rim”.
People have devised many methods of surviving the upheavals in the “ring of fire”. In Alaska, earthquakes are so extreme, that it is an ideal location for continuous research. In Chile and Hawaii, research focuses on ocean and tidal problems. Japan and New Zealand offer insight into anti-quake designs. In San Francisco, planning, communication, training and organisation have assisted in reducing risk to life and property, as well as preparing for future problems.

results.title: Preparing and conducting an interview
results.creator_credit: Video Education Australasia and Justin Shortal
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Finding out”.
Kylie’s class has been set the task of recording an interview with an aspect of their own choice. We follow Kylie’s progress as she moves through a process of preparing and conducting an interview.

results.title: Preparing a cupola for charging
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Foundry Practice”.
Explains how to recognise the end of a heat; the procedure for dropping bottom; and the procedures for preparing a cupola for its next heat.

results.title: Prepare to dive
results.brief_description: The training of Australia’s new submarine corps. Initial training takes place on HMS Dolphin stationed in England, from where they are often posted to HMS Maidstone in Scotland. These highly trained men are bringing a new power to Australia’s defence.

results.title: Preparation of teachers: student teachers meet two problems in understanding children
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation and Julien Bryan
results.brief_description: A dramatised account of the training of teachers in USA, centred round two students studying at a laboratory school at the Ball States Teacher’s College, Indiana. The emphasis is one the need to understand children, to provide for individual pupil differences and to develop desirable personal traits in teachers.

results.title: Preparation for parenthood
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Rank Organisation, Frank Wells and Thora James
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Physiology of Human Reproduction”.
The changes which take place in the body during puberty are shown followed by a brief resume of development of the embryo, lactation, menstruation and how multiple births may occur.

results.title: Prenom Carmen = First Name Carmen
results.creator_credit: WDR La Sept Cinema and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description:
The plot involves a gang of thieves, a kidnapping and a certifiably burnt-out film director played by Godard. The central characters, Joseph and Carmen, are based on Jose and Carmen in Merimee’s story, with a Beethoven string quartet substituting for Bizet’s music. The conception of Carmen - the woman as a destructive, amoral force - is also close to that of Marianne/Anna Karina in ‘Pierrot le fou’. But typically, Godard is interested not in letting the narrative proceed so much as in brushing it aside. What Pauline Kael aptly calls “the pop clarity” of his sixties movies here gives way to an ambivalent art-cinema overlay on a mix of B-movie plot, a pessimistic wit and modernist-romantic introspection about the relationship between art and life. Awards: Venice Film Festival 1983 - Golden Lion.

Credits: Producer, Alain Sarde ; director, Jean-Luc Godard ; photography, Raoul Coutard, Jean-Bernard Menoud ; writer, Anne-Marie Mieville ; editor, Jean-Luc Godard ; music, Ludwig Van Beethoven, Tom Waits.
Cast: Maruschka Detmers, Jacques Bonnaffe, Myriem Roussel, Christophe Odent, Jean-Luc Godard, Jacques Villeret, Hippolyte Girardot, Jean-Pierre Mocky.

results.title: Prenatal development & the birth process
results.creator_credit: George A. Colburn and Darrel Schwandt
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Examines research on the prenatal period, as well as neonatal starting dates that facilitate an infant’s survival. Alternative birth processes are analysed. Families in Brazil, Russia and the U.S. prepare for birth and go through delivery. Human genetics principles, prenatal care and risk factors are considered.

results.title: Prenatal development
results.creator_credit: CRM Educational Films, McGraw-Hill Films and Barbara Jampel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Emphasizes the importance of environment influences on the human foetus. Traces foetal development from conception to birth. Discusses the effects of a deficient diet, drugs taken by the mother and her state of pregnancy.
